The plant is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions such as India, Sri Lanka, and parts of Indonesia. Gymnogramma mathewsii thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocky substrates or in forest undergrowth. Its intricate frond structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and botanical collections.
